sub_title: Leidinggevende & Verkenner / Manager & Explorer @ NOVA Rijkswaterstaat

projects.title: Global Outlook on Water Integrity 2015
projects.description:
The Water Integrity Global Outlook 2015 will be an authoritative survey of issues and best practices in water integrity supporting evidence-based advocacy, policy-making and collective action. Coordinated by 8 international partners, the Global Outlook is a collaborative platform to exchange experiences in promoting water integrity worldwide. It will focus on key topics debated in the sector today, including: river basin management, integrity in water and sanitation, policy, tools and ICT developments, advocacy campaigns, and capacity development. The results of this international collaboration will be published in the second half of 2015.

For the Global Outlook on Water Integrity I am coordinating the chapter on ´Advocacy initiatives and strategies´. We are still looking for experts who would like to contribute by sharing their experiences and/or submitting cases. Please contact me if you are interested.

contributors.headline: Leidinggevende & Verkenner / Manager & Explorer @ NOVA Rijkswaterstaat

projects.title: Mau Mara Serengeti Sustainable Water Initiative (MaMaSe)
projects.description:
The MaMaSe Sustainable Water Initiative is aimed at improving water safety and security in the Mara River Basin to support structural poverty reduction, sustainable economic growth and conservation of the basin’s ecosystems. In this four year programme the people and institutions in the basin will be supported in a process of structural change, promoting water-wise economic development that lifts people out of poverty and sets them on a sustainable path to improved well being and self-reliance.

The Initiative, which is financially supported by the Netherlands Embassy in Nairobi, Kenya, consists of a broad-based public private partnership including international and Kenyan government agencies, civil society, private sector, NGOs, and knowledge institutions. It is led by UNESCO-IHE together with Kenya Country Office of World Wildlife Fund (WWF)

contributors.headline: Leidinggevende & Verkenner / Manager & Explorer @ NOVA Rijkswaterstaat

projects.title: Local Water Integrity Programme in Guatemala
projects.description: The aim of this assignment is to document and share experiences from the Local Water Integrity Programme in Guatemala. The programme is executed by Helvetas Guatemala. I visited Guatemala in August and interviewed a number of local water committees (in San Marcos & Huehuetenango), municipalities, inspectors, regional health authorities. I also spoke with actors at the national level such as the Ministry of Health. At the moment I´m compiling the experiences and developing a brochure, which will be published before the end of the year.

projects.description: Preparing and organising a knowledge sharing workshop on integrity and good governance for water sector stakeholders in the Netherlands and a number of developing countries.

profile_positions.description:
A flexible and future-proof Rijkswaterstaat - that is what the NOVA department contributes to. We do that by exploring (outside) trends and developments that we expect will impact the work of Rijkswaterstaat. And, more importantly, we experiment with new solutions and ways of working, organising and cooperating.  Together of course with our Rijkswaterstaat colleagues and partner organisations and businesses.  

Rijkswaterstaat is the national authority for water ways and roads in The Netherlands.
profile_positions.title: Leiddinggevende & Verkenner / Manager & Explorer @ NOVA

profile_positions.description:
As "omgevingsmanager" I am responsible for the strategic stakeholder management of several projects in the North of Holland. This means that I am connecting Rijkswaterstaat with partners in the area, and analyse (power) relations, interests and long-term developments and opportunities. 
I enjoy working in innovative projects in a complex environment, where I can develop and experiment with new methods, strategies, etc. Coordination, coaching and process management are also important elements of my work. Stakeholders I work with include government agencies (local/regional/national), companies, knowledge institutes, citizen groups etc. 

Projects (past & present):
- Co-creatie Toekomst Noordersluis (www.toekomstnoordersluis.nl) 
- Procesmanager IJ-oeververbindingen Amsterdam
- Coördinerend omgevingsmanager Vervanging & Renovatieprogramma Noord-Holland
- Corridorcentrale Scheepvaart Amsterdam
- Implementatie Omgevingswet

Rijkswaterstaat is part of the Dutch Ministry of Infrastructure and Water Management. The agency is responsible for the design, construction, management and maintenance of the main infrastructure facilities in the Netherlands. Rijkswaterstaat takes care of the main waterway network, watersystems and the main road network.
profile_positions.title: Omgevingsmanager - strategic stakeholder management

company.name: IRC I international water and sanitation think-and-do tank

profile_positions.description:
IRC is an international think-and-do tank that works with governments, NGOs, entrepreneurs and people around the world to find long-term solutions to the global crisis in water, sanitation and hygiene services. At the heart of its mission is the aim to move from short-term interventions to sustainable water, sanitation and hygiene services. IRC runs large-scale programmes in seven focus countries in Africa, Asia and Latin America and projects in more than 25 countries. 

As governance expert I was part of IRC's International and Innovation department and contributed to several international water programmes. My work included research (e.g. institutional and stakeholder mapping), programme management, consultancy, knowledge sharing and capacity development.  I was involved in projects in Nepal, India,  Cambodia, Ghana and Ethiopia.
profile_positions.title: Governance expert, international and innovation programme

company.name: Ministry of Infrastructure and the Environment

profile_positions.company: Ministry of Infrastructure and the Environment
profile_positions.description:
Together with Rozemarijn ter Horst I coordinated the Netherlands National IHP-HWRP Committee. This Committee consists of representatives of Dutch water-related Ministries, research institutes and operational agencies. As secretaries we formed the link between the Dutch water sector and the water programmes of UNESCO and WMO. In 2014 we conducted consultations with Dutch water sector stakeholders and developed a strategy for the Committee, which was adopted in May 2014. We also supported the Dutch Permanent Delegation at UNESCO in Paris by preparing and participating in the IHP Intergovernmental and Bureau meetings. In November 2015 we organised an international expert workshop about smart monitoring of water-related SDG targets together with the German and Belgian IHP Committees.

For more info about the Committee have a look at our website: www.ihp-hwrp.nl  

The International Hydrological Programme (IHP) is the only intergovernmental programme of the UN system devoted to water research, water resources management, and education and capacity building. UNESCO hosts the IHP Secretariat, which serves UNESCO’s 195 Member States through the IHP National Committees, other governmental bodies, and academic and research institutions in the implementation of the programme. .
profile_positions.title: Secretary Netherlands Committee for UNESCO and WMO (IHP-HWRP)

profile_positions.description: Several times a year Vice Versa publishes a special edition on a specific theme related to development cooperation. Together with journalist Sarah Haaij I´ve set up a special edition on water and development, which will be published in June 2013. We are jointly coordinating the content of the magazine and also writing some of the articles. I have written for example an article on the activities of the Dutch water sector in Jakarta.

profile_positions.company: IHE Delft Institute for Water Education
profile_positions.description:
Projects include:

1. Preparing 6th World Water Forum:
-Assist in coordination work for all relevant sessions UNESCO-IHE is involved with and streamline processes leading up to the Forum 
- Organize an interactive session on Communication and Awareness Raising entitled ´Effective water communications and awareness raising through global and integrated networks´ at the 6th World Water Forum. 

2. Developing outputs 6th World Water Forum:
- Online open source water communications toolkit for (water) communication specialists, media professionals and also water experts on communicating and reporting on drinking water, sanitation, hygiene, food security, and health issues. 
- Online water communications network for water communication specialists, media professionals and interested water experts.
- Water communications short/summer course at UNESCO-IHE.

3. Preparation of the Annual Report of UNESCO-IHE: 
Collecting information, preparing texts, overseeing and coordinating the design work, outsourcing the final edit of the report.

4. Editorial coordinator of UNESCO-IHE Update Magazine November issue (coordinating and developing editorial content etc.).
